instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising the ssd, fan spins and chimes.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no ssd detected. wifi works, it chimes, usb mouse powers up, fan does not cycle. im getting voltage to the ssd coil. main rails appear to be ok.

History, Liquid damaged but was ultrasonicly cleaned by previous tech. <CAPACITOR>C1053</CAPACITOR>  Pin2 GND was corroded so i ran jumper to <CAPACITOR>C1043</CAPACITOR> Pin2 GND. 
<CHIP>U5800</CHIP> has been messed with but dont think this has any affect, i could be wrong. <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> looks like its been reflowed as it has hallmarks of a tech who uses no flux, it seems okay. <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> has had its <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/2 resistors replaced. and Fuckme the smc silicone is gone! <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> has obviously been changed too. all in all this system looks pretty healthy. no burnt points. Oh JTAG is missing.

any assistance on where to start would be great. ill start measuring the rails again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising the ssd, fan spins and chimes.
threads.message:
Ive tried to factory reset it but it hangs and does not go any further than connect to wifi and apple logo loading.

after double checking some rails it appeared that i was not getting <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> it was reading 2.19v and flucuating. <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> voltages were screwed so i replaced it and now pp3v42 is present but still no SSD showing up. ive tried with a good known ssd with os already loaded but still no detection.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising the ssd, fan spins and chimes.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising the ssd, fan spins and chimes.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising the ssd, fan spins and chimes.
threads.message:
All good there.
Did you try other SSD, or this one in other machine?

Check if <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> arrives to J3700.
Also check <SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL> and all capacitors from data lines.
Pay atention to <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 too.
